result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  All costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in count 3 are to to paid during this period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Restitution is set at zero.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
PARENTING CLASSES.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15 pm.

supervisions.notes: All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during period of probation in count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Anthony McClendon Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Denying Defendant's Request for Huber Privileges, signed, filed and distributed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges (work and school).

Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Upon motion of the statee, the court orders count dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
AS to count 2:    Defendant sentenced to serve  9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to 15CM1524 with credit for 43 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. PARENTING CLASSES.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  All costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in count 3 are to to paid during this period of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at zero.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.
AS to count 3:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 60 days time served.  All costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 2.

Due to the unavailability of branch 38 on 8-7-2015, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.  Attorney Ramon Valdez,  was present and advised of the adjourned date.  Clerk advised the State of the new court date.   mld

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Discussion regarding case 15CM1524. Court GRANTED transfer of 15CM1524 from Branch 24 to allow for a global resolution with this case. Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court, defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Status Conference date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence Anthony McClendon Jr
Current: 4037 N 47TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 05-08-2015)
Prior: 7251 West Appleton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RAJANEE J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Lawrence Anthony McClendon in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
